title: Tourist arrivals to Slovakia increase rapidly in first half of 2015Travelandtourworld.com
text:
Tourist arrivals to Slovakia increase rapidly in first half of 2015 Published on : Tuesday, August 25, 2015
The Slovakia tourism industry is on the rise again after a slump in 2014 when the number of travellers shrank drastically. A total of 1.894 million tourists arrived in Slovakia in the first half of 2015.
The report was published by the Slovak Tourism Board (SACR) based on data of the Slovak Statistics Office on Aug 24. Out of the 1.894 million people, 734,000 travellers were from abroad and 1.16 million were Slovaks which amounts to 10.4 and 9.5 percent for foreign and domestic tourists respectively.
The year-on-year increase of the number of travellers choosing Slovakia has holiday destination has been put at 10% which exceeds the record year of 2013, the TASR newswire reported.
Tourists from almost all countries have recorded increase with the maximum number of tourist arrivals from China which beats all other countries hands down. Chinese tourists number soared by a whopping 115 percent followed by British tourists which stood at 42 percent.
The number of Polish tourists increased by 4.1 percent, Czechs increased by 9.4 percent, Hungarians by 12 percent, Germany grew 13.7 percent and the number of Austrian tourists increased by 22 percent.
The number of tourists from Australia increased by 29 percent and the USA went up by 23 percent.
Increased tourist arrivals contributed to increased tourism revenue over the first half of 2015 which increased €27 million to bring the total to €924 million.
